H0.text: The car has a larger mass requiring less force to stop, which explains why it stops in a shorter distance than the truck when both vehicles are traveling at the same speed toward a stop sign.

H1.text: The car has a smaller mass requiring more force to stop, which explains why it stops in a shorter distance than the truck when both vehicles are traveling at the same speed and approach a stop sign.

H2.text: The truck has a smaller mass requiring less force to stop in the situation where a car and a truck are traveling at the same speed toward a stop sign, and the car stops in a shorter distance than the truck.

H3.text: The truck has a larger mass requiring more force to stop, which explains why the car stops in a shorter distance than the truck when both travel at the same speed toward a stop sign.

A4.text: If one body has much greater mass than the other, its velocity will be little affected by a collision while the other body will experience a large change

A5.text: momentum is conserved in both reference frames
